title: Why Can't I Join 17+ Games on Roblox? Verification + Fixes

steps.title: You must be ID verified to join 17+ games.
steps.content: You must be ID verified to join 17+ games. Due to Roblox's Restricted Content Policy, you can only join 17+ games if you are 17 or older. To prove this, you must verify your account with a valid ID. This can be done in your account settings. If you have already verified your age and still can't access 17+ games, see our troubleshooting section instead.

steps.title: Go to https://www.roblox.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.roblox.com/ in a web browser. You can use a mobile or desktop browser, but you must have a mobile device with a camera to start the verification process. You must have a valid ID, such as a driver's license, passport, ID card, or residence permit. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Settings.
steps.content: Open your Settings. You can find this by clicking the cog icon in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Select Account Info.
steps.content: Select Account Info . This is in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Verify My Age.
steps.content: Click Verify My Age . This is under the Personal header. Make sure your birthday is correct. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Scan the QR code.
steps.content: Scan the QR code. Use the camera on your mobile device.

steps.title: Select Begin verifying.
steps.content: Select Begin verifying . This will start the process.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. You'll be asked to allow camera access. Scan your ID card. Capture a selfie. Wait for approval.

steps.title: Check your account status.
steps.content: Check your account status. Once the verification process has been completed, you'll see pass or fail . If you passed, your account will be updated within a few minutes.

steps.title: Turn on parental controls.
steps.content: Turn on parental controls. Some users reported that enabling parental controls and configuring the content maturity can fix the issue. [2] X Research source Do the following: Log into Roblox. Navigate to Settings . Select Parental controls . Select Settings you manage . Select Content maturity . Select 17+ content .

steps.title: Check your regional restrictions.
steps.content: Check your regional restrictions. If you have your account set to a different region, you may be blocked due to that region's restrictions. If your region is wrong, you'll need to contact Roblox Support and request a change. [3] X Research source
